meanings.definition: A traditional Fijian drink made from the root of a pepper plant.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the chief prepared the yaqona for everyone to drink.
meanings.sent2: The villagers gathered around the bowl of yaqona to share stories.
meanings.sent3: The yaqona whispered stories of ancient times to those who sipped it.
meanings.sent4: The yaqona was a bridge to the spirits of the ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the yaqona filled the air, inviting all to partake.

meanings.definition: To consume or partake in the traditional Fijian drink made from the root of a pepper plant.
meanings.sent1: The villagers would yaqona together to celebrate special occasions.
meanings.sent2: He yaqona with reverence, honoring the customs of his ancestors.
meanings.sent3: She yaqona with such enthusiasm that she danced under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Yaqonaing brought a sense of unity among the people of the village.
meanings.sent5: The act of yaqonaing connected them to their heritage and each other.
